metaTags.metaTitle: First-hand lessons from the rise of the distributed workforce
metaTags.metaDescription: First-hand lessons from the rise of the distributed workforce

relatedBlades.title: First-hand lessons from the rise of the distributed workforce
relatedBlades.copy:
Enormous diversity in internal applications — and the dizzying array of devices remote employees use to access them — have rendered traditional, network perimeter-based security postures obsolete. This shift presents every organization with unique challenges.

How have forward-thinking IT leaders navigated this shift? Hear from several of them in their own words below.

# <center>[Udaan](https://www.cloudflare.com/case-studies/udaan-access/)</center>

## <center>India’s largest ecommerce platform finds simplicity in Zero Trust Security</center>

features.title: Problem: VPN frustration
features.description: Udaan wanted to simplify access management for a distributed workforce of thousands of employees, freelancers, and partners. “VPNs are frustrating and lead to countless wasted cycles for employees and the IT staff supporting them,” said co-founder Amod Malviya.

features.title: Solution: Zero-Trust Security
features.description: Udaan ditched their VPN in favor of a Zero Trust approach. “With Cloudflare Access, we have a far more reliable, intuitive, secure solution that operates on a per user, per access basis. I think of it as Authentication 2.0 — even 3.0”

relatedBlades.copy:
# <center>[Replicated](https://www.cloudflare.com/case-studies/how-replicated-uses-cloudflare-access-to-develop-remotely/)</center>


## <center>Infrastructure software company secures its shift to the cloud</center>

features.title: Problem: Cumbersome access management
features.description: Replicated developers had to maintain local Kubernetes development environments on their computers — a time sink and data loss risk. “We’d lose hours every week from engineers troubleshooting their local environments.” − Marc Campbell and Grant Miller, Co-founders

features.title: Solution: Embrace the cloud
features.description: Now, Replicated developers use cloud-based Kubernetes environments — and can access them securely on any machine. "Cloudflare Access provides a BeyondCorp-style method of authentication, which ensures that the environment can be reached from anywhere in the world without the use of a VPN."

relatedBlades.copy:
# <center>[Holtmeyer & Monson](https://www.cloudflare.com/case-studies/how-holtmeyer-monson-keeps-its-remote-team-secure-with-cloudflare-gateway/)</center>
  
## <center>A lending services provider keeps its remote team secure with Cloudflare Gateway</center>

features.title: Problem: Securing an all-remote workforce
features.description:
"Our whole team is remote, working from home offices. We don’t have a server room with hardware firewall appliances, and it wouldn’t really make sense to have one. So I’m always looking for ways to keep our team more secure and harden their connections, wherever they are."
− Stephen Webb, Director of IT

features.title: Solution: Network filtering at the DNS level
features.description: H&M monitor Internet-bound DNS queries passing through their network, and proactively block malicious attacks and phishing attempts. “With [Cloudflare Gateway], I know that we’re getting protection from the latest emerging attacks, because of the scale of its network and the number of attacks it can derive insights from — it has that intelligence first.”

relatedBlades.subtitle: Need help enabling access for remote employees?
relatedBlades.copy:
Schedule a discovery session to learn how to secure your devices, networks, and internal applications with Cloudflare for Teams.

We'll cover:

- How Cloudflare for Teams secures every connection without compromising user performance
- Simple, secure access for internal apps with Cloudflare Access
- A secure path to the Internet with Cloudflare Gateway
